clinical_study.brief_title: Observation of Use of Claritin (Loratadine) Tablet, RediTabs, and Dry Syrup in Children (Study P05834)(COMPLETED)
clinical_study.official_title: Claritin速 Tablet 10 mg, Claritin速 RediTabs速 10 mg, Claritin速 Dry Syrup 1% Drug Use Investigation (Pediatrics)

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to collect information on unexpected adverse reactions (ADRs), how often ADRs occur, and factors that can affect the safety and effectiveness of Claritin (loratadine) when used in children. Patients will be observed while they are taking Claritin, and ADRs and symptom scores will be recorded. At the end of treatment, improvement in symptoms will be recorded.
Post-marketing surveys are not considered applicable clinical trials and thus the results of this survey will not be posted at its conclusion. The results will be submitted to public health officials as required by applicable national and international laws.

primary_outcome.measure: Unexpected adverse drug reactions (ADRs) that had not been detected in pre-approval clinical studies
primary_outcome.time_frame: During and at the end of the observation period

primary_outcome.measure: Allergic rhinitis: nasal symptom scores (paroxysmal sneeze, nasal discharge, nasal congestion, and intranasal itching)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Before the start of treatment, during the observation period, and at the end of the observation period

primary_outcome.measure: Urticaria, eczema, dermatitis, pruritus cutaneous: severity score of itching
primary_outcome.time_frame: Before the start of treatment, during the observation period, and at the end of the observation period

secondary_outcome.measure: Allergic rhinitis: Markedly improved, Moderately improved, Mildly improved, Unchanged, Worsened, Unassessable
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of the observation period

secondary_outcome.measure: Urticaria, eczema, dermatitis, pruritus cutaneous: Resolved, Improved, Unchanged, Worsened, Unassessable
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of the observation period

arm_group.description: Pediatric patients who are treated with Claritin for any of the following reasons: allergic rhinitis, urticaria, itching due to skin disease (eczema, dermatitis, or pruritus cutaneous)

intervention.description: Claritin Tablet 10 mg, Claritin RediTabs 10 mg: For pediatric patients aged 7 years and older, 10 mg of loratadine is orally administered once daily after a meal in usual cases. Claritin Dry Syrup 1%: For pediatric patients aged 3 to < 7 years, 5 mg loratadine (0.5 g dry syrup); and for pediatric patients aged 7 years and older, 10 mg of loratadine (1 g dry syrup) is dissolved immediately before use and orally administered once daily after a meal in usual cases. The observation period will not be specified.

study_pop.textblock: Pediatric patients who are treated with Claritin at a department of pediatrics, department of otorhinology, department of dermatology, etc. at approximately 120 institutions

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Pediatric patients aged 3 to 15 years who are treated with Claritin for any of the following reasons: allergic rhinitis, urticaria, itching due to skin disease (eczema, dermatitis, or pruritus cutaneous)
Exclusion Criteria:
- (None)
